prop.name: defaultValue
prop.desc: The default value of the input.  For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

prop.name: minValue
prop.desc: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

prop.name: valuePattern
prop.desc: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

prop.name: stepValue
prop.desc: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

prop.name: valueMaxLength
prop.desc: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

prop.name: readonlyValue
prop.desc: Whether or not a property is mutable.  Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

prop.name: valueMinLength
prop.desc: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

prop.name: maxValue
prop.desc: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

prop.name: valueName
prop.desc: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

prop.name: multipleValues
prop.desc: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property.  Default is false.

prop.name: valueRequired
prop.desc: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action.  Default is false.
